name: Reef Village Resort

reviews.text: We just had 3 1/2 days for a short weekend escape from Guatemala City and decided to take the vanr to Belize City and then fly to San Pedro. Our destination was the Reef Village resort and this is the place to be. We had a villa on the water front - 3 bedrooms, kitchen, hug living room, a/c, fans and a sun roof top and at Reef Village there's an island in the lagoon with bar, restaurant, tour center and some life music nearly every evening. They even have a theater now but it dos not yet play movies. The next beach is 2 minutes walking distance and to town you walk 20 minutes along the beach.
reviews.title: Cool long weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people at Reef Village are very friendly, food is very good and the staff especially in the restaurant and front office is very friendly and helpful. Good to know that there are safe beaches not too far from Guatemala - this will be our vacation spot whenever we can escape from the daily hassle. You must ask for a discount!
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very pleased with the accommodations, staff, and amenities. The villa was spectacular and included modern amenities and breathtaking views of its own private lagoon. With a fully staffed bar and restaurant serving delicious food and drinks all day in center of the lagoon, Reef Village offered the perfect vacation getaway and serene atmosphere.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reef Village has it all. We stayed in a villa on the water and it was so fun, comfortable and convenient to town (San Pedro). The staff was very accomodating, helpful and nice. The pool, bar and restaurant is located on an island in the middle of all the villas and condos which is very convenient and the food at the restaurant was very good.
reviews.title: A wonderful and unique experience.

reviews.text: My third trip to Ambergris Caye, Belize and Reef Village Resort was the best so far! Very friendly local people. Surprisingly fantastic food and service. Belize is a slow paced place, so don't expect anything to happen quickly, just breathe it all in and go with the laid-back flow of the Island. I liked the mix of Mexican, Mayan and Belizian cultures so much, I bought a Villa in Reef Village. Don't expect Hawaii, the sandy roads and rustic atmosphere is all part of the wonderful and unique experience.
reviews.title: Slice of Paradise
Be sure and say "hi" to Spottie!
reviews.text: Who is Spottie? The resorts mascot!

reviews.title: This is "The Place" on San Pedro
reviews.text: He is a local dog that was pretty beat up and the owners took him in and got him back to new! For those of us who are dog lovers it was great to see his happy face everyday!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from our room was absolutely fantastic and the staff went above and beyond to help!
reviews.title: relaxing and friendly. very accomodating

reviews.text: Love, love, loved it! Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.text: Great condo fully furnished with a full kitchen. The beds were very comfortable. The condo is very well furnished and beautiful. The patio out back was amazing for cocktails, grilling and watching the sun set. But wait, there's more. The pool, bar and restaurant were great. The staff is top notch and we felt very welcome.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Friendly, Relaxing

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a week and enjoyed our stay. It is a bit far from town, a twenty minute walk (hot) but it's also more quiet as a result which we like. The pool is very nice and the lagoon is pretty. We saw a manta Ray and lots of jelly fish in the lagoon. Our room was cleaned daily. The cleaning staff did our dishes, washed our towels daily and did a good job. The front desk was very helpful. They helped with our airport transfer. We showed up at the airport without informing them beforehand b/c we thought we can just take a taxi but the taxis cannot cross the small bridge. The airport staff called them for us and 20 min later, Reef Village had a golf cart pick us up. Over all the experience was very positive. The condo apartment was very nice.
reviews.title: My husband and I stayed here for a week...

reviews.text: I traveled with two girlfriends to Reef Village and we stayed from 8/14/10 to 8/21/10. I have been a timeshare owner in the Bahamas for 22 years and this was the first time I utilized Interval to trade. I am sooo glad I chose Reef Village. I have a 3-bedroom/3-bath villa and my reservation confirmation from RV was for the same. When we arrived, they put us in a 3-bedroom/2-bath, which just wouldn't do. I went to the office and told them that I was very unhappy and they immediately transferred us to the most beautiful 3-BR/3Bath villa. It was very spacious. The decor was beautiful. Our maid, Elena, came every day and did an outstanding job. The food at The Palm was delicious and the service was excellent. I tried to eat all of their coconut shrimp -- soooo good! Just sitting on the veranda with the glorious view was worth the trip! Carla in the office was very accommodating and wanted to make sure you received only the best service. I gave the place 4 stars instead of 5 because of two things: (1) there was a critter in my bathroom (which they promptly handled) (although I don't do bugs, I understand that we are in the tropics and this will happen, BUT, I still don't want to see critters -- EVER!); and (2) as upscale as this place is, i don't understand why they don't have dishwashers. I certainly don't go on vacation to wash dishes. Of course, they say, the maid will do the dishes, but we may eat something at night time and I'm not the type of person to leave dishes in the sink overnight. Other than those two things, everything was PERFECT. Barry the bartender was great and very personable. When I go back to Belize, I can't imagine staying any place other than Reef Village.
reviews.title: Paradise
Definitely "Average". Stay elsewhere.
reviews.text: While I was there, I was planning on writing far worse comments, but in retrospect, it was "average". Pros: large rooms, nice pool, nice staff who go out of their way to help you, fairly nice views. Cons: too far from town (mainly because of road conditions and toll bridge), bugs, including cockroaches, in rooms, tiny bathrooms, yellow water, construction and loud workers everywhere, construction debris all around, making views less favorable. I would love to tell you to stay here, but I really wouldn't recommend it. If I had it to do over again I would have stayed in town or south of town. Also, don't count on Wi-fi, it literally works 10%of the time (and only around pool area). Another note--the power went out at least 10-15 times in the week we were there, sometimes up to 2-3 hours at a time. This is not the hotel's fault, but a common problem "north of the bridge".

Having been to San Pedro a few times I/we chose to stay at Reef Village in San Pedro in April 2010, after we had stayed at a few lower quality resorts. Reef Village is/was wonderful whilst we were there as the quality of the furniture and facilities was/is great as is the cleanliness and I would recommend this place without question to anyone who is considering visiting Belize and San Pedro.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All though the resort was a little out of the town, the Golf cart supplied by the resort more than compensated for that as we travelled from one side of the island to the other without any hiccups.
reviews.title: FABULOUS!

reviews.text: We sat through a timeshare presentation last year and "won" a week stay with the booking fee, of course added to the "free" lodging. The Reef Village Resort assigned us to a three bedroom villa, so my wife & I and two other couples took advantage of the week. The villa was spacious. The upstairs suite -- bedroom and bathroom -- was roomy. It had its own flat screen TV and a very large bathroom. The two bedrooms downstairs shared a bathroom. The living room was roomy and had a flat screen TV. There was a full kitchen, dining room and tucked into a closet -- a washer & dryer. The A/C worked very well.
reviews.title: Not really a resort but a nice place to stay...

reviews.text: The cleaning crew came around daily. They were quite helpful on a couple of occasions -- changing the filter on the washing machine and taking some clothes to get some stains out. The lead housecleaner was very nice and attentive to our requests.
reviews.title: Closer than you think...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Complaints: the water system is pressurized via a surge tank in each villa. Ours was loud and clunky (duly reported) but at least the water pressure was good. Also, the villas do not have closets, so no real way to hang clothes.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodations and Leisure

reviews.text: There is still construction going on so there is a dust issue and early morning noise issue. The housecleaner took care of the dust that got into the villa and the noise -- well, we just used that as an alarm clock so we wouldn't be late for diving or snorkeling trips. The noise is unavoidable and not a big deal.
reviews.title: excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a grocery store near the entrance to the resort. I would recommend getting a 5 gallon jug of water and asking housekeeping for a dispenser. DO NOT DRINK THE TAP WATER! Anywhere on the island! Bottled water is available everywhere.
reviews.title: Perfect and friendly place in Belize

description: Reef Village Resort - one of the most beautiful places in the country offering luxury condos and villas with up to 4 bedrooms at reasonable rates among some of the finest amenities on the island, restaurant with delicious local and Intl. cuisine, bar and pool on a cool island in the middle of the lagoon. Incredible packages and tour offerings ensure your Belize vacation will exceed your expectations of luxury, comfort, adventure and fun!
